title: Wendy Williams is diagnosed with aphasia and frontotemporal dementia
description: News of the former TV host's medical diagnosis comes days ahead of the TV premiere of Where is Wendy Williams? — a two-part documentary detailing her health battles.

title: Guinness World Records posthumously strips Bobi of his title of 'oldest dog ever'
description: Bobi's owner said the dog had lived a record-breaking 31 years and 165 days old when he died in October 2023. But a review by Guinness World Records found that evidence of his age was inconclusive.

title: Leaked document trove shows a Chinese hacking scheme focused on harassing dissidents
description: The large cache of more than 500 documents posted online anonymously last week details one Chinese tech company's hacking operations, target lists and marketing materials for the Chinese government.

title: How Trump's trials for 91 felony charges in 4 states could take over his campaign
description: New York Times reporter Alan Feuer is part of a team covering Trump's legal battles. The first of four criminal case trials against the former president is expected to start March 25.

title: After siding with Alabama ruling that embryos are children, Haley defends IVF access
description: Nikki Haley agreed with an Alabama Supreme Court ruling that said frozen embryos are considered children. But Thursday, she also reiterated that fertility treatments should not be taken away.

title: Soccer star Dani Alves is found guilty of rape and sentenced to 4 1/2 years in prison
description: Dani Alves, one of the most successful soccer players of his generation, was found guilty of raping a woman in a Barcelona nightclub in 2022.

title: Delta's special total solar eclipse flight sold out in 24 hours
description: An Austin, Texas-to-Detroit flight along April's path of totality is sold out. There are other flights with a view, though your best bet may actually be here on Earth, says one astrophysicist.

title: Some USDA programs have been mired in inequity. A panel's final report offers changes
description: An equity commission created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture has released over 60 recommendations it says will finally bring more fairness to policies affecting farming and rural America.

title: AT&T cellphone service out for tens of thousands across the country
description: Reports of outages spiked around 3:30 a.m. ET, reaching more than 71,000 within a few hours. AT&T says it is aware of the problem and "working urgently to restore service."

title: They came to clinics in Mexico for cosmetic surgery and got a deadly fungal meningitis
description: The risks of medical tourism are depicted in a study of U.S patients who traveled to two clinics for procedures like tummy tucks and butt lifts — and were exposed to a virulent fungal meningitis.

title: Haley says Biden is 'more dangerous' than Trump; Boeing ousts head of 737 Max program
description: In an interview with NPR, Nikki Haley says in a rematch between Biden and Trump, Biden is a bigger threat. Boeing has removed the executive in charge of the troubled Boeing 373 program.

title: What fighting in the Middle East means for the U.S. troop presence in Iraq
description: After the U.S. killed a commander of an Iran-backed militia in Baghdad, pressure is mounting on Iraq's government to expel America's 2,500 military personnel.

title: Scientists scanning the seafloor discover a long-lost Stone Age 'megastructure'
description: The more than half mile long wall, called the Blinkerwall, was likely used by Stone Age hunter-gatherers to herd reindeer toward a shooting blind.

title: A hospital is suing to move a quadriplegic 18-year-old to a nursing home. She says no
description: The young North Carolina woman has refused to go to a nursing home in another state. While she wants to leave the hospital, she asks to live in her own home, close to family and her school.

title: How the dead serve as bargaining chips in the Israel-Hamas conflict
description: Israel and Hamas are both holding the bodies of those killed on the other side, refusing to release them. They've done so for years and are again using the enemy dead as leverage in the current war.

title: Sen. Joe Manchin on why he can't endorse Trump, but isn't sold on Biden
description: West Virginia Democratic Sen. Joe Manchin talks to NPR's Michel Martin about Joe Biden, Donald Trump and Nikki Haley, and his decisions against another run for the Senate or a new bid for president.

title: Feast your eyes on Taiwan's distinct food (and understand a history of colonization)
description: Taiwan has endured a long history of colonization. As a trip to the culinary center of Tainan reveals, those outside forces have helped create a cuisine that is distinctly Taiwanese.

title: Nikki Haley says Biden is 'more dangerous' than Trump but neither is fit for the job
description: In an interview with NPR, Nikki Haley says in a rematch between President Biden and former President Donald Trump, Biden is a bigger threat. But she's hoping she presents voters with another option.

title: What GOP infighting in South Carolina can (and can't) tell us about 2024
description: In Horry County, South Carolina, a squabble over who is the official county party sheds light on struggles the GOP faces more broadly in 2024.

title: Private company Intuitive Machines is set to land on the moon. Here's what to know
description: The Houston-based company hopes to make the first successful commercial landing on the lunar surface. It would also be America's first soft landing in decades.

title: A man shot dead in Spain may be a Russian army defector
description: A man who was shot dead in the region of Alicante, in Spain, is believed to be Maksim Kuzminov, a Russian helicopter pilot who defected to Ukraine last year.

title: China says it plans to send more pandas to the San Diego Zoo this year
description: In November, Chinese President Xi Jinping raised hopes his country would start sending pandas to the U.S. again after he and President Joe Biden convened in Northern California.

title: Alabama seeks to carry out 2nd execution using controversial nitrogen gas method
description: Alabama Attorney General Steve Marshall's office asked the state Supreme Court on Wednesday to set an execution date for Alan Eugene Miller. The state said the execution would use nitrogen.

title: A girl dies after a sand hole on a Florida beach collapses
description: The collapse of a sand hole that killed a 7-year-old Indiana girl who was digging with her brother on a Florida beach is a danger that kills and injures several children a year around the country.
